conclusion: The problem involves a charged ball suspended by a string in a uniform electric field.

A ball of mass \\( m \\) and charge \\( q \\) is suspended by a string of length \\( L \\). The ball is at an angle \\( \theta \\) from the vertical, and there is a uniform electric field in the horizontal direction.
The ball is at rest, so the forces acting on it must balance.
There are two main forces: the tension \\( T \\) in the string and the electric force \\( F_E \\) due to the electric field.
The vertical component of the tension balances the weight of the ball: \\( T \cos \theta = mg \\).
The horizontal component of the tension balances the electric force: \\( T \sin \theta = qE \\).
